Brazosport Water Authority
Executive Summary
A) BWA policy to perform work in a manner that protects the health and safety of empoyees and the public, preserves the quality of the environment and prevents property damages using BWA  Safety and Chlorine Systems SOP Manuel.

Brazosport Water Authority release policies are as follows: 1. Utilize written job procedures involving handling of chlorine. 2. All BWA Personnel annually review written procedures. 3. All operations and maintenance personnel are trained (in-house and TCEQ classes).  4. All operations and maintenance personnel obtain and maintain a "C" surface water license from TCEQ. 5. All operation and maintenance personnel are annually HAZWOPER certified.  6. Chlorine gas system is vaccum from regulator on the liquid chlorine cylinder to the water aspirator.   

Emegency Response policies are as follows: 1. Notify Lake Jackson Fire Dept. 2. Do not attempt a repair of a leak or rescue without self contained breathing air apparatus. 3. Evacuate all non essential personnel  4. Do not repair a leak alone. 5. All BWA Personnel have required HAZWOPER training. 5. All maintenance and operations BWA  Personnel are annually trained and certified on SCBA  6. All maintenance and operations BWA Personnel are Bi-Annually trained and certified in CPR and First Aid via Red Cross. 

B) Brazosport Water Authority maintains liquid chlorine in 2,000 pound cylinders on site for disinfection of drinking water.
Chlorine maximum amount is 24,000 pounds

C) The general accidental release prevention program
   1. All repetitive jobs require a written procedure
      all SOP include consequences of deviation! 
   2. All operators and maintenance personnel are trained in release prevention
   3. Require all operators and maintenance personnel to be HAZWOPER trained
   4. Review all chemical carriers for safety and release prevention program
   
  D)  Accidental release chlorine prevention
   1. All operators and maintenance personnel

are trained in release prevention
   2. Only AWWA approved chlorine equipment and materials are utilized
   3. All chlorine handling tasks require a written approved job procedure and annual review
   4. All chlorine carriers are reviewed for accidental release prevention training program
   5. Daily inspection of chlorination system
   6. Daily testing of chlorine leak detection system
   7. Rebuild, test and inspection of all chlorine regulators and chlorine dioxide generators quarterly

  E) Five year accident history
    There have been no reportable accidental releases for chlorine from Brazosport Water Authority
     Water Plant in the past five years.

  F) Planned changes to improve safety
   1. Continue with monthly saftey topic with written modules
   2. Continue to have personnel take TCEQ Safety Classes. 

  G) Prevention Program Training 
      Certification and documentation of Operators training
     1. BWA certified all operators working as of June 21, 1999.
     2. Operators trained after June 21, 1999 tested or certified by BWA Management..
         See BWA Training Log 

   H) Prevention Program Maintenance
       Documentation of:
      1. Formal written preventive maintenance program for all
         chlorine equipment or chlorine handling equipment.
         See BWA Chlorine equipment inspection and maintenance log.
     2. Chlorine Delivery contractor is delivery equipment properly maintained and
         operator is properly trained.
     3. Chlorine process equipment has been tested and inspected according to
         recognized and generally accepeted engineering practices.
      
    I) Emegency Response policies are as follows: 
      1. BWA facility first responder is shift leader operator on duty.
      2. BWA first responder will notify Lake Jackson Fire Dept. when needed. 
      3. Do not attempt a repair of a leak or rescue without self contained breathing air apparatus. 
      4. Evacuate all non essential personnel.  
      5. Medi

cal help if needed.
          Refer to  BWA Emergency Response SOP
